name: Advanced ARC Powercell
uses: Occasionally used for advanced projects; can also be broken down to basic powercells
notes: Good if you’re short on standard powercells, otherwise treat as high-value salvage

name: Advanced Electrical Components
uses: High-tier Workshop and Expedition upgrades; required in Expedition 'Outfitting' stage
notes: Do NOT recycle if you still need Caravan upgrades; otherwise great late-game scrap

name: Advanced Mechanical Components
uses: Used heavily in Gunsmith and ARC weapon projects. need for gunsmith 3
notes: Keep a stash for gun/ARC component upgrades

name: Agave
uses: Converted to Assorted Seeds; used by Celeste for trading
notes: Nature currency; keep if you trade with Celeste

name: Antiseptic
uses: Medical Lab upgrades and some quests
notes: Keep until Medical Lab III and related quests are done

name: APRicot
notes: Save early for Scrappy milestones; extra can be converted

name: ARC Alloy
uses: Core upgrade mat for many Workshop tiers and ARC salvage breakdowns
notes: Absolutely essential; required in huge quantities especially for Expedition 'Foundation' stage

name: ARC Circuitry
uses: High-tier Refiner, power projects, advanced ARC tech
notes: Valuable mid–late game; don’t mass-recycle until benches are maxed

name: ARC Coolant
uses: Chemical farming; used in some crafting chains
notes: Fantastic chemical yield; safe to scrap if you’re done with projects

name: ARC Flex Rubber
uses: Rubber-hungry projects and Expedition Foundation stage
notes: Great way to farm rubber; recycle surplus

name: ARC Motion Core
uses: Upgrades tied to ARC enemies; used to craft Bastion/Bombardier/Leaper/Matriarch parts
notes: Important for late ARC components—hoard until you’re done with those projects

name: ARC Performance Steel
notes: High metal yield; good salvage after core upgrades are done

name: ARC Powercell
uses: Base power requirement for stations and early projects
notes: Foundational power item; can’t be recycled, but used everywhere early on

name: ARC Synthetic Resin
notes: Excellent plastic yield; good farm material late game

name: ARC Thermo Lining
notes: Great source of fabric; recycle extra after you finish relevant benches

name: Assorted Seeds
uses: Primary currency for Celeste; also shows up in nature crafts
notes: Do NOT recycle; treat as currency for nature trader

name: Bastion Cell
uses: High-end Workshop upgrades connected to Bastion enemies
recycle_outputs: 2x ARC Motion Core; 2x Advanced Mechanical Components
notes: Late-game ARC resource; don’t recycle until those upgrades are done

name: Battery
uses: Used in Expedition Framework stage, electronics, and many salvage breakdowns
notes: Common power unit; core basic material that can’t be recycled itself

name: Bicycle Pump
uses: Pure salvage item; no quest uses
notes: Classic 'safe to recycle' junk—great early metal + canister income

name: Bombardier Cell
notes: Treat similar to Bastion Cell; only recycle after those projects are crafted

name: Burned ARC Circuitry
uses: ARC salvage that recycles into alloys
notes: Nice way to convert junk into more alloys; safe salvage

name: Canister
uses: Used in Humidifiers, coolant-style items, and some Expedition materials
notes: Generally safe to recycle unless you’re crafting Humidifiers for Caravan

name: Chemicals
uses: Base ingredient for explosives, coolant, antiseptic, etc.
notes: Core basic resource; un-recyclable but demanded everywhere

name: Complex Gun Parts
uses: Break down into Simple Gun Parts; used in advanced weapon mods
notes: Usually best to break down when you need core gun parts

name: Coolant
notes: Good mixed-chem/oil salvage item; safe if not earmarked for quests

name: Cooling Coil
uses: Appears in cooling-related crafting and salvage
notes: Solid source of springs & chemicals; safe salvage if not needed for projects

name: Cooling Fan
uses: Needed for Expedition 'Core Systems' stage and some projects
notes: **Don’t recycle until Caravan/Workshop needs are met**—then it’s great scrap

name: Cracked Bioscanner
uses: Used in some Medical Lab upgrades and quests
notes: Hold a few for Medical upgrades; extra can be salvaged

name: Crude Explosives
notes: Bench-gate material—keep until Explosives Station II/III are done

name: Crumpled Plastic Bottle
notes: If you’re short on plastics, these are safe to recycle

name: Damaged ARC Motion Core
uses: ARC salvage that feeds back into alloys
notes: No direct quest use; safe salvage if you don’t need the flavor item

name: Damaged ARC Powercell
notes: Generally safe salvage; treat as a way to grow your alloy stockpile

name: Damaged Fireball Burner
notes: Safe salvage unless you’re collecting for flavor

name: Damaged Heat Sink
uses: Metal/ wire-heavy salvage; minor Workshop use
notes: Good mixed salvage; keep only if a specific upgrade calls for it

name: Damaged Hornet Driver
notes: Safe salvage into alloys

name: Damaged Rocketeer Driver
notes: High-alloy salvage; good to recycle

name: Damaged Snitch Scanner
notes: Low priority; only keep if you like the flavor item

name: Damaged Tick Pod
notes: Safe alloy salvage

name: Damaged Wasp Driver
notes: Safe alloy salvage

name: Degraded ARC Rubber
notes: Great way to turn junk into rubber stock

name: Diving Goggles
notes: Safe rubber salvage unless you collect it as a trinket

name: Dried-Out ARC Resin
notes: Efficient plastic source; safe to scrap

name: Duct Tape
notes: Safe to recycle if you’re not fabric-starved

name: Durable Cloth
uses: Medical Lab II; Expedition 'Core Systems'; quests
notes: **Key Caravan material; do not recycle until Expedition and quests are satisfied**

name: Electrical Components
notes: Critical mid-game currency; recycle ONLY if overstocked

name: Exodus Modules
notes: Late-game item—treat carefully; recycle only when sure you’re done with its use

name: Expired Respirator
notes: Good rubber/fabric bundle; safe salvage unless an upgrade calls for it

name: Explosive Compound
notes: Keep early; later you can recycle for basic explosive mats

name: Fabric
uses: Generic cloth for many upgrades and Expedition tiers
notes: Foundational fabric resource; non-recyclable and used everywhere

name: Fertilizer
notes: Useful for one quest and as seed converter; recycle only if massively overstocked

name: Fireball Burner
uses: ARC explosive salvage and Workshop projects
notes: Good mixed alloy+chem salvage; safe if no specific upgrade is pending

name: Fried Motherboard
notes: Nice hybrid scrap; safe after you have enough Elec Components

name: Geiger Counter
uses: Exodus crafting component; Stella Montis/Exodus loot. Recycles into 1x Exodus Module + 3x Batteries.
notes: Radiation-monitoring Exodus device; currently only known use is recycling into high-tier materials.
sources: Stella Montis Exodus loot (North Line, Nov 2025)

name: Great Mullein
notes: Treat like Agave/fruit; usually better to keep/convert than recycle

name: Headphones
notes: Good salvage; safe if not needed for a specific upgrade chain

name: Heavy Gun Parts
notes: Break down if you need generic gun parts

name: Hornet Driver
uses: Non-damaged Hornet ARC part; some Workshop uses
notes: Valuable mixed salvage; keep a few, recycle surplus

name: Household Cleaner
notes: Excellent chemical yield; safe once chem needs are covered

name: Humidifier
notes: **Keep for Expedition; recycle only after that’s complete**

name: Ice Cream Scooper
notes: Safe metal scrap

name: Impure ARC Coolant
notes: Decent chem yield; safe salvage

name: Industrial Battery
uses: Higher-tier battery/chem salvage and gear bench 3
notes: Good way to boost both batteries and chemicals

name: Industrial Charger
notes: Safe late-game salvage

name: Industrial Magnet
notes: Safe to recycle unless needed for magnet-based upgrades

name: Ion Sputter
uses: Exodus crafting component; Stella Montis/Exodus loot. Recycles into 1x Exodus Module + 4x Voltage Converters.
notes: High-value Exodus tech from Stella Montis / Rocket Assembly. No specific quest use known yet; safe to recycle once you’re comfortable on Exodus Modules.
sources: Stella Montis Exodus loot (North Line, Nov 2025)

name: Laboratory Reagents
uses: Chemicals and explosives for higher-tier Med/Explosive projects
notes: Great advanced chem/explosive bundle

name: Lemon
notes: Keep for Scrappy levels and seeds

name: Leaper Pulse Unit
notes: **Key Expedition item**—don’t scrap until Caravan is done

name: Light Bulb
notes: Treat as keep-only until Caravan needs are fulfilled; cannot be recycled

name: Light Gun Parts
notes: Break down when you need generic gun parts

name: Magnet
notes: Safe salvage; basic mid-tier mat

name: Magnetron
uses: Exodus crafting component and Snap and Salvage quest item for Tian Wen in Stella Montis.
notes: Required along with a Flow Controller for Tian Wen’s Snap and Salvage quest in Stella Montis; only recycle extras after the quest and any future uses are done.
sources: Wiki + community reports (Magnetron Exodus item, Nov 2025)

name: Magnetic Accelerator
uses: Matriarch/Queen reactors, Expedition 'Outfitting', legendary Equalizer weapon
recycle_outputs: 1x Advanced Mechanical Components; 1x ARC Motion Core
notes: Extremely important—keep for reactors and legendary crafts

name: Matriarch Reactor
uses: High-level ARC/Expedition crafting; alternative legendary component
notes: Legendary-tier salvage; usually better kept than recycled

name: Mechanical Components
uses: Core mid/late-game crafting and Expedition 'Framework' stage
notes: One of the most in-demand resources in the game

name: Medium Gun Parts
notes: Break down for generalized gun parts

name: Metal Brackets
notes: Safe metal junk to recycle

name: Metal Parts
uses: Everywhere: Caravan 'Foundation' stage, almost all Workshop tiers
notes: Baseline metal currency—never in doubt, you always need tons

name: Mod Components
notes: High-end material; recycle only if done with mods

name: Moss
notes: Situational; more for flavor than progression

name: Motor
uses: Oil + Mechanical component bundle and needed for refiner 3
notes: Valuable mixed salvage; safe when not needed by specific recipes

name: Mushroom
notes: Keep for Scrappy progression; not recyclable

name: Oil
uses: Used in many mechanical and fuel recipes
notes: Convert surplus to chemicals, but keep enough for Synthesized Fuel/Rocket Thrusters

name: Olives
notes: Use like other fruits for Scrappy and seeds

name: Plastic Parts
uses: Core plastic resource for a ton of crafts
notes: Terminal plastic currency; non-recyclable but used everywhere

name: Polluted Air Filter
notes: Good hybrid salvage; safe after fabric/oil requirements are met

name: Pop Trigger
notes: Nice little alloy+explosive combo scrap

name: Portable TV
notes: Great electronic scrap; safe recycle

name: Power Bank
notes: Standard salvage; safe if batteries are not a bottleneck

name: Power Cable
notes: Strong wire source; safe once wire-heavy upgrades are done

name: Power Rod
uses: Core piece in Queen/Matriarch reactors and other legendary crafts
notes: Very high-end; only recycle when you’re absolutely sure you’re done using it

name: Prickly Pear
notes: Treat like Lemon/Olives for nature economy

name: Processor
uses: Electronics crafting; appears in advanced salvage
notes: Good general electronic material; typically safe salvage

name: Projector
notes: High-value salvage; safe when not needed as a trinket

name: Queen Reactor
uses: Crafts the Equalizer (legendary weapon) and other very high-end content
notes: Ultra-rare drop from ARC Queen; almost never worth recycling

name: Radio
notes: Solid salvage; safe after any flavor use

name: Resin
uses: Generic nature mat; some minor crafts
notes: More of a flavor/nature currency item

name: Rocketeer Driver
uses: ARC Rocketeer component for high-end Workshop
notes: Late-game salvage; keep a few, scrap surplus

name: Ripped Safety Vest
notes: Nice bundled salvage; safe once Caravan cloth needs are done

name: Rocket Thruster
uses: Fuel + metal salvage; often appears in rocket-related Workshop/quests
notes: Valuable bundle; safe salvage when you’re not crafting with it

name: Roots
notes: Generally safe to convert rather than recycle

name: Rope
uses: Fabric-based crafting; occasionally used in projects
notes: Safe salvage if you’re not short on fabric

name: Rotary Encoder
uses: Exodus crafting component; Stella Montis/Exodus loot. Recycles into 2x Electrical Components + 2x Processors.
notes: Movement/position sensor hardware; good source of Processors via recycling.
sources: Stella Montis Exodus loot (North Line, Nov 2025)

name: Rubber Pad
notes: Top-tier rubber farm item; safe to recycle

name: Rubber Parts
uses: Huge requirement for Caravan 'Foundation' and many upgrades
notes: Like Metal Parts, this is a core baseline resource—never truly 'extra'

name: Rusted Bolts
notes: Safe metal junk

name: Rusted Gear
uses: Metal + Mechanical Components salvage, need for gunsmith 3
notes: Very strong salvage; keep only if a quest specifically calls for it

name: Rusted Shut Medical Kit
notes: Good medical salvage; safe if Med Lab is upgraded

name: Rusted Tools
notes: Great salvage; features in some guides as a good farm item

name: Rusty ARC Steel
notes: Safe salvage; generic metal junk

name: Sample Cleaner
uses: Exodus crafting component; Stella Montis/Exodus loot. Recycles into 2x Electrical Components + 14x Assorted Seeds.
notes: Turns contaminated samples into useful electronics and seeds on recycle; good if you’re short on basic Electrical Components.
sources: Stella Montis Exodus loot (North Line, Nov 2025)

name: Sensors
uses: Used in electronics projects and Expedition 'Framework' stage
notes: Important for mid/late Expedition; don’t over-salvage early

name: Sentinel Firing Core
uses: ARC Sentinel salvage; high-value Workshop material
notes: Very strong salvage; also appears in some high-level upgrade chains

name: Signal Amplifier
uses: Exodus crafting component; Stella Montis/Exodus loot. Recycles into 2x Electrical Components + 2x Voltage Converters.
notes: Boosts radio/Exodus signal strength; currently best treated as premium recycle fodder for Voltage Converters.
sources: Stella Montis Exodus loot (North Line, Nov 2025)

name: Simple Gun Parts
uses: Core gun mod material; produced from other gun parts
notes: Baseline gun-parts currency; you’ll use these a lot

name: Snitch Scanner
notes: Good mid/late salvage; safe to recycle when upgrades are finished

name: Speaker Component
notes: Decent hybrid salvage

name: Spring Cushion
notes: High value for cloth/spring farming; safe salvage late

name: Spotter Relay
notes: Useful mid-game; safe salvage once you’re done with spotter-related upgrades

name: Steel Spring
uses: Used heavily in Expedition 'Foundation' and Mod Components
notes: Important early/mid game; treat as semi-precious for Caravan

name: Surveyor Vault
uses: Mechanical + ARC Alloy bundle; rare salvage
notes: Good salvage but also appears in some high-end uses; keep a few

name: Synthesized Fuel
uses: Rocket/fuel crafting; used in Rocket Thruster
notes: Safe salvage resource, but keep enough if you craft thrusters

name: Syringe
uses: Medical-themed crafting, part of Med salvage chains
notes: Useful for medical projects; salvage if overflowing

name: Tattered ARC Lining
notes: Good late-game fabric source

name: Tattered Clothes
notes: Safe general salvage

name: Thermostat
notes: Nice hybrid salvage; safe after you’re stocked on sensors

name: Tick Pod
notes: Safe salvage

name: Toaster
notes: Strong electronic scrap; safe salvage

name: Turbo Pump
notes: High-value mechanical salvage

name: Unusable Weapon
notes: Basically a gun-parts piñata; safe salvage

name: Voltage Converter
uses: Used in some electrical chains; drops from Industrial Charger
notes: Safe salvage once generator/charger-style upgrades are done

name: Wasp Driver
notes: Useful for Workshop; recycle only surplus

name: Water Filter
uses: Quest/expedition utility item; also good salvage
notes: Check quests first—then it’s safe recycling material

name: Water Pump
uses: Quest item (appears in some Caravan objectives); salvage
notes: Keep a few for quests; scrap extras

name: Wires
uses: Huge Expedition requirement and core in most electronics
notes: Do NOT aggressively recycle early; they’re a bottleneck for Expedition & benches
